item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 2, 2025 at 3:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The early days of Linux (2023) (68 points | 11 comments)
2. The most unhinged video wall, made out of Chromebooks (332 points | 33 comments)
3. Show HN: Berlin Swapfest – Electronics flea market (122 points | 20 comments)
4. How Flash games shaped the video game industry (57 points | 29 comments)
5. Show HN: I made a website where you can create your own "Life in Weeks" timeline (107 points | 27 comments)
6. Nuclear Reactor Lasers: From fission to photon (32 points | 2 comments)
7. Firefly Blue Ghost Mission 1 Lunar Landing (33 points | 6 comments)
8. Rifling through the archives with Robert Caro (13 points | discuss)
9. Euclid finds complete Einstein Ring in NGC galaxy (38 points | 2 comments)
10. Python as a second language empathy (2018) (33 points | 15 comments)
11. Efabless – Shutdown Notice (87 points | 34 comments)
12. China tells its AI leaders to avoid U.S. travel over security concerns (300 points | 227 comments)
13. Making o1, o3, and Sonnet 3.7 hallucinate for everyone (187 points | 145 comments)
14. Abusing C to implement JSON parsing with struct methods (54 points | 6 comments)
15. Show HN: I took over Painteresque, a 14 year old Objective-C app and rebuilt it (43 points | 12 comments)
16. Maestro – Next generation mobile UI automation (133 points | 51 comments)
17. Unleashed Recompiled – Unofficial PC Port of Sonic Unleashed (21 points | 2 comments)
18. Drone captures narwhals using their tusks to explore, forage and play (50 points | 11 comments)
19. What do people see when they're tripping? Analyzing Erowid's trip reports (142 points | 181 comments)
20. GLP-1 drugs: An economic disruptor? (2024) (307 points | 393 comments)
21. Why can't we screenshot frames from DRM-protected video on Apple devices? (95 points | 99 comments)
22. Video encoding requires using your eyes (68 points | 30 comments)
23. Certificate Transparency in Firefox (161 points | 95 comments)
24. Why it's so hard to build a jet engine (349 points | 172 comments)
25. Xcode constantly phones home (147 points | 48 comments)
26. Backyard bird has a lot to teach us about sex variability (13 points | discuss)
27. Emacs Tree-sitter custom highlighting (72 points | 7 comments)
28. 3,200% CPU Utilization (460 points | 205 comments)
29. GSA Eliminates 18F (418 points | 347 comments)
30. Wealthy Americans fuel half of us economy consumer spending (17 points | 7 comments)
